item.title: Sara add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am not young enough to know everything." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sara add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Indeed I have always been of the opinion that hard work is simply the refuge of people who have nothing to do." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sara add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sara add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Morality is simply the attitude we adopt towards people we personally dislike." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sara add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Selfishness is not living as one wishes to live, it is asking others to live as one wishes to live." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sara add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Life is far too important a thing ever to talk seriously about." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sara add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description:
"<b>The preachers and lecturers deal with men of straw, as they are men of straw themselves</b>. Why, a free-spoken man, of sound lungs, cannot draw a long breath without causing your rotten institutions to come toppling down by the vacuum he makes. Your church is a baby-house made of blocks, and so of the state.
...The church, the state, the school, the magazine, think they are liberal and free! It is the freedom of a prison-yard." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Sara add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "We must learn to reawaken and keep ourselves awake, not by mechanical aids, but by an infinite expectation of the dawn, which does not forsake us even in our soundest sleep. I know of no more encouraging fact than the unquestionable ability of man to elevate his life by a conscious endeavour. It is something to be able to paint a particular picture, or to carve a statue, and so to make a few objects beautiful; but it is far more glorious to carve and paint the very atmosphere and medium through which we look, which morally we can do. To affect the quality of the day, that is the highest of arts." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Sara add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Any fool can make a rule And any fool will mind it." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Sara add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "The smart way to keep people passive and obedient is to strictly limit the spectrum of acceptable opinion, but allow very lively debate within that spectrum...." -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Sara add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "If we don't believe in freedom of expression for people we despise, we don't believe in it at all." -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Sara add a quote by Dolly Parton
item.description: "It costs a lot of money to look this cheap" -- Dolly Parton

item.title: Sara add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "Change will not come if we wait for some other person, or if we wait for some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Sara add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "There's not a liberal America and a conservative America - there's the United States of America." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Sara add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Some people never go crazy. What truly horrible lives they must lead." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Sara add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "those who escape hell however never talk about it and nothing much bothers them after that." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Sara add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "You begin saving the world by saving one man at a time; all else is grandiose romanticism or politics." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Sara add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Sara add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face. You are able to say to yourself, 'I have lived through this horror. I can take the next thing that comes along.' You must do the thing you think you cannot do." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Sara add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you feel in your heart to be right – for you’ll be criticized anyway." -- Eleanor Roosevelt
